lines.content: Hello! This is a **ChatBot** named **Altria** for you to manage your own task and stuffs.
The Memory of the ChatBot is stores in **data/saver.txt**. The bot will create
the data automatically when the first you start using it.
The ChatBot can add the task you want to do to its memory by typing on commandline
you may refer to usage for a detail explanation.
You can also manage the tasks with some simple command like `delete` or view all the tasks with
Type the following command in command line to use the **ChatBot** :
### `delete` - Delete a Task with it's index
I see, I will remove the task 3
Now you have 2 tasks in my memory
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
### `find` - Find the task with a given name
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
### `todo` - Add the todo task to the list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
### `deadline` - Add the Deadline task to the list
Example of usage:`deadline finish the IP /by 2024-03-08`
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### `event` - Add the event task to the list
Example of usage:`deadline finish the IP /by 2024-03-08`
You can also use date format like 2023-07-30
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
If you encounter any problems or want to contact with me, feel free to contact me at
**yzhanglp0730@gmail.com**. You can also visit my [personal website](https://yzhanglp.com) for my information!
* Represents the Add Command. A Add object corresponds to
System.out.println("\tYou can also use date format like 2023-07-30");
* Execute the Add command with a given task
System.out.println("\t" + "Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + tasksList.size() + " tasks in the list. \n");
System.out.println("\tStatus changed, I will save the data for you!");
System.out.println("\tSorry, I do not understand your command.");
System.out.println("\tSorry, you should use \\ to indicate the time!");
* Execute the Add command with a given task
System.out.println("\t"+"Bye.Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents the Base Command. An abstract class of all the command.
* Represent the execution of the command, an abstract method
* @param tasksList represent the tasksList of the ChatBot
* @throws IOException if save or Load meet IOException
public abstract void execute(ArrayList<Task> tasksList) throws IOException;
* Represents the Delete Command. A Delete object corresponds to
public void execute(ArrayList<Task> tasksList) throws IOException {
System.out.println("\t" + "I see, I will remove the task " + deleteNumber + "\n");
System.out.println("\t" + "Now you have " + tasksList.size() + " tasks in my memory \n");
System.out.println("\tStatus changed, I will save the data for you!");
System.out.println("\tInput error: please enter an number less than "+this.deleteNumber+"!");
* Represents the Execution process. A execution object corresponds to
* a execution process which is going to wrong.
* Construction function of the execution create the command according to user input parser
* @param tasksList represent the tasksList of the ChatBot
* @param parser represent the parser of the user input Command
* @throws Command_Not_Exist if user input a command does not exist
public Execution(Parser parser , ArrayList<Task> tasksList) throws Command_Not_Exist {

* Represents the Mark Command. A Mark object corresponds to
public void execute(ArrayList<Task> tasksList) throws IOException {
System.out.println("\t"+"Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("\tStatus changed, I will save the data for you!");
System.out.println("\tInput error: please enter an number less than "+this.markNumber+"!");
* Represents the Unmark Command. A Unmark object corresponds to
public void execute(ArrayList<Task> tasksList) throws IOException {
System.out.println("\t" + "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("\tStatus changed, I will save the data for you!");
System.out.println("\tInput error: please enter an number less than "+this.markNumber+"!");
